div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Unlawful Detention of Seventy-six Hindoo Aliens
RETURN TO THE ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE AND PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
TO THE HONORABLE JUDGE OF THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON:

Comes now Ellis DeBruller, Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of Seattle and makes this, his return to the petition for writ of habeas corpus and the order to show cause heretofore issued in the above entitled matter and alleges as follows:
I.
Respondent denies each and every allegation contained in paragraph 2 of said petition except that he respectfully admits that the petitioners resided for various periods in the Philippine Islands.
II.

Respondent admits the allegations contained in paragraph 3 of the petition and admits that said restraint is by virtue of a warrant based upon Section 20 of the Act of February 20, 1907, as amended, and respectfully denies each and every other allegations contained in paragraph 4 of the petiton.
III.
Respondent denies each and every allegation contained in paragaphs 5 to 18 inclusive of the petition.
IV.
Respondent admits the allegations contained in paragraphs 19 of the petition.
V.
Respondent denies each and every allegation contained in paragraphs 20 to 25 inclusive of said petition.

As an affirmative return to said order to show cause, respondent alleges that he, the said Ellis DeBruller, holds that said Hindoos as aliens arrested within three years after entry subject to deportation, and now ordered to be deported by the Commissioner of Labor, all as provided by the Act of February 20, 1907, as amended by the Act of March 26, 1910, and March 4, 1913, and rules and regulations provided for therein; that a hearing was given said aliens as provided by law, a full and complete transcript of which hearing is filed herewith, and that the warrant of deportation by the Secretary of Labor referred to in paragraph 19 of the petition, and by virtue of which respondent holds said aliens, was based on said hearing.
WHEREFORE, Respondent prays that the order to show cause, and the temporary restraining order heretofore issued by discharged, and that this action be
dismissed.
& Ellis DeBruler Commissioner of Immigration
E B Brockway Assistant United States Attorney
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
SS

ELLIS DEBRULLER, being first duly sworn on oath, deposes and says: That he is the Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of Seattle and is the respondent in the above entitled action; that he has read the foregoing return to the order to show cause herein, knows the contents thereof and that the same is true as he verily believes.
Ellis DeBruler
SUBSCRIBED and sworn to before me this 26th day of August, 1913.
Edm Lakin Deputy Clerk, U.S. Dist. Court, Western Dist. of Washington
